SENT.plain: The authors report the case of a 5-year-old boy referred for thrombocytopenia and neutropenia
Bone marrow examination showed a myelodysplasia with clonal monosomy 7
The acceleration of the disease was marked by the appearance of an additional cytogenetic abnormality, i.e., the deletion of the long arm of chromosome 5 in the clonal cells
RAS gene mutation was not detected
Chemotherapy was started to achieve complete remission before a bone marrow transplantation
This treatment was complicated by a prolonged aplasia and the patient died of systemic mycotic infection
